ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: i would recommend it. i think the readings were very good and this discussion was interesting for the most part
It's a good introduction course to fulfill your requirement.

Psyc 509 provides students with an overview of the foundation of work in social cognition. I would recommend this class to other students as it has been helpful to see how a different field views various topics and thinks about psychology.
I'd recommend it to someone who's interested in social psychology.
a must take for any first year in any behavioral field .
I would recommend this course to another psychology graduate student interested in social cognition research, even if it is not his or her main area of study.

I would recommend it. The nature of the course including free discussion does mean that it will be a new enriching experience for each new class. The core readings are a must for anyone interested in the field.
Exposure to a lot of social psychology research.
I would recommend this class to anyone interested in psychology because it covers a great deal of interesting material in sufficient depth and breadth.
yes.

A course that covers a broad range of social psychological topics with a special focus on automatic and unconscious processes.I would recommand it as it is a course that contains some of the most important phenomena in our field.
absolutely

Yes, I would recommend this class as a good core course for a fellow student. It provides a good overview of the intriguing field of social cognition and is accessible to all psychology students. Those with backgrounds in either social or cognitive psychology may find the course especially enjoyable.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: mmmm. The course was not hugely helpful. It was interesting though.
This course was to fulfill a requirement by the department and didn't really contribute to my own research in a meaningful way.

This course allowed me to see how social psychologists think and gave me exposureto many topics that characterize the field. This course did not benefit too much to my research as I work in a completely different field, with very little overlap. Nontheless it has really be great having this class give me a different framework with which to think about psychology.
i will use many many of these ideas and papers in my professional research. this class was fantastic!
This course helped provide me with a foundation in social cognition methods and research, which is useful for my research.
This coursework directly applies to my research.
This course provided a great overview of the literature in the area.

I feel that this course was highly relevant for my work, although it is in a different, yet related area. A broad knowledge of the social cognition literature and of the concepts covered in this class will be valuable to me when I think of research ideas for the future.

It gave me on the one hand information about some classic studies and enlarged my basic knowledge of social psychology, on the other hand it treated several very new studies so that I have an idea about the state of art nowadays. The course helped me to orient better in social psychology.
As a political scientist, this course was very helpful in getting a grounding in current social psychology research and addressed many topics indirectly and directly relevant to political psychology.
